lessons.title: Welcome to Birth Doula Coaching: Setting the Stage
outline: Introduction to the Certified Birth Doula Coach™ program and its objectives.
Overview of the G.U.I.D.E. Framework™ and its application in coaching doulas.
Understanding the role and responsibilities of a Birth Doula Coach.
Ethical considerations and scope of practice for doula coaches.
Building rapport and establishing trust with doula clients: communication and active listening skills.

lessons.title: Defining Your Coaching Philosophy and Niche
outline: Identifying your personal coaching style and values.
Exploring different niches within the doula coaching landscape (e.g., business development, specific client populations, specialized doula skills).
Determining your ideal doula client profile.
Crafting a compelling coaching mission statement and value proposition.
Assessing your current skills and experience as a coach, identifying areas for growth.

lessons.title: Creating a Vision for Your Coaching Practice
outline: Setting SMART (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound) goals for your coaching business.
Visualizing your ideal coaching practice: client base, income, work-life balance.
Identifying potential challenges and obstacles to achieving your vision.
Developing a preliminary action plan to launch and grow your coaching practice.
Understanding the importance of self-care and boundary setting as a coach.

lessons.title: The Doula Landscape: Opportunities and Challenges
outline: Analyzing the current state of the doula profession: trends, statistics, and emerging needs.
Identifying common challenges faced by doulas in their practice (e.g., client acquisition, burnout, financial sustainability).
Exploring opportunities for doulas to expand their services and impact (e.g., specialized training, community partnerships, online platforms).
Understanding the competitive landscape of doula services in different regions.
Identifying resources and support systems for doulas and doula coaches.

lessons.title: Introduction to the 'G' Phase: Laying the Foundation
outline: Understanding the critical importance of thorough information gathering in the coaching process, setting the stage for effective interventions.
Defining the scope of information needed for birth doula coaching, including professional background, business practices, and personal goals.
Introducing the various methods and tools for gathering information, such as questionnaires, interviews, and observation.
Ethical considerations in information gathering: confidentiality, informed consent, and data security.
Setting client expectations for the information-gathering process and establishing a collaborative coaching relationship.

lessons.title: Client Intake Forms: Designing for Doula-Specific Needs
outline: Designing comprehensive client intake forms tailored to the unique aspects of a birth doula's practice.
Key sections to include in the intake form: professional experience, certifications, client demographics, service offerings, and pricing.
Assessing the client's current business model: marketing strategies, client acquisition methods, financial management, and administrative processes.
Identifying the client's strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats (SWOT analysis) through targeted questions.
Incorporating questions about the client's personal goals, values, and work-life balance preferences.
Best practices for form design: clarity, conciseness, and user-friendliness.

lessons.title: The Initial Interview: Building Rapport and Extracting Key Insights
outline: Structuring the initial interview to build rapport and establish trust with the doula client.
Effective questioning techniques: open-ended questions, probing questions, and clarifying questions.
Active listening skills: demonstrating empathy, summarizing key points, and reflecting on the client's emotions.
Identifying the client's core values, beliefs, and motivations related to their doula practice.
Exploring the client's past experiences, successes, and challenges in the doula field.
Uncovering the client's perceived barriers to achieving their goals and aspirations.

lessons.title: Assessing Business Operations: Uncovering Hidden Bottlenecks
outline: Analyzing the client's current business operations: client management, scheduling, communication, and record-keeping.
Evaluating the effectiveness of the client's marketing and sales strategies: website, social media presence, networking activities, and referral programs.
Assessing the client's financial management practices: budgeting, pricing, invoicing, and expense tracking.
Identifying potential bottlenecks and inefficiencies in the client's workflow.
Reviewing the client's contracts, policies, and procedures to ensure legal compliance and professional standards.
Determining the client's level of satisfaction with their current business operations.

lessons.title: Evaluating Doula Skills and Expertise: Identifying Areas for Growth
outline: Assessing the client's doula skills and expertise: childbirth education, labor support techniques, postpartum care, and bereavement support.
Identifying areas where the client may need additional training or mentorship.
Exploring the client's knowledge of current evidence-based practices in maternal and newborn care.
Evaluating the client's ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with healthcare providers.
Assessing the client's cultural sensitivity and awareness in providing doula services.
Using role-playing scenarios to evaluate the client's practical skills in challenging situations.

lessons.title: Understanding the Client's Ideal Client Profile and Target Market
outline: Defining the client's ideal client profile: demographics, psychographics, and specific needs.
Analyzing the client's current client base to identify common characteristics and patterns.
Evaluating the client's target market: market size, competition, and growth potential.
Assessing the client's understanding of their target market's needs and preferences.
Identifying opportunities for the client to niche down and specialize in a specific area of doula care.
Developing strategies for the client to attract and retain their ideal clients.

lessons.title: Analyzing the Competitive Landscape: Identifying Opportunities for Differentiation
outline: Researching the competitive landscape: identifying other doulas in the client's area.
Analyzing the competitors' strengths, weaknesses, pricing, and service offerings.
Identifying opportunities for the client to differentiate themselves from the competition.
Developing a unique selling proposition (USP) that highlights the client's unique value and expertise.
Creating a competitive advantage by focusing on a specific niche, target market, or service offering.
Monitoring the competitive landscape and adapting the client's strategies as needed.

lessons.title: Synthesizing Information and Creating a Client Profile
outline: Synthesizing all the information gathered from intake forms, interviews, and assessments.
Creating a comprehensive client profile that summarizes the client's background, goals, strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats.
Identifying the client's primary coaching needs and priorities.
Developing a preliminary coaching plan based on the client profile.
Presenting the client profile and coaching plan to the client for feedback and validation.
Ensuring that the client profile is accurate, complete, and reflects the client's unique needs and aspirations.

lessons.title: Identifying Doula Strengths and Core Skills
outline: Understanding the spectrum of doula skills: emotional support, physical comfort, informational resources, advocacy.
Self-assessment tools for doulas: questionnaires, checklists, and reflections on past experiences.
Identifying unique strengths: What makes the doula stand out in their approach and expertise?
Analyzing client testimonials and feedback to pinpoint perceived strengths.
Practical exercise: SWOT (Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, Threats) analysis tailored for doula practices.

lessons.title: Recognizing Limiting Beliefs and Mindset Blocks
outline: Defining limiting beliefs and their impact on professional growth and business success.
Common limiting beliefs among doulas: imposter syndrome, fear of failure, undervaluing services.
Techniques for identifying and challenging limiting beliefs: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) based exercises, journaling, and affirmations.
Case study analysis: How limiting beliefs manifested in a doula's practice and the strategies used to overcome them.
Building a growth mindset: Cultivating resilience, embracing challenges, and viewing setbacks as learning opportunities.

lessons.title: Assessing Current Doula Business Practices
outline: Reviewing key business aspects: marketing strategies, client acquisition, service packages, pricing models, and financial management.
Analyzing current client base and identifying target client demographics.
Evaluating online presence: website, social media, and online directories.
Assessing networking and referral strategies: relationships with healthcare providers, childbirth educators, and other birth professionals.
Identifying areas for improvement in operational efficiency and client experience.

lessons.title: Discovering Untapped Opportunities in the Doula Market
outline: Identifying emerging trends in the birth and postpartum landscape: VBAC support, LGBTQ+ families, single parents by choice.
Exploring niche specializations within doula work: bereavement doula, sibling doula, fertility doula.
Analyzing local market needs and identifying underserved populations.
Brainstorming innovative service offerings: online consultations, group workshops, specialized packages.
Leveraging technology and digital platforms to expand reach and accessibility.

lessons.title: Aligning Personal Values with Professional Goals
outline: Identifying core personal values: integrity, compassion, autonomy, creativity, etc.
Defining professional goals: short-term and long-term objectives for the doula practice.
Assessing alignment between personal values and professional goals: identifying potential conflicts and areas of synergy.
Developing a values-driven mission statement for the doula practice.
Creating a vision board to visualize desired outcomes and reinforce alignment.

lessons.title: Leveraging Existing Resources and Support Networks
outline: Identifying available resources: professional organizations, mentorship programs, online communities, training opportunities.
Building a strong support network: connecting with experienced doulas, healthcare providers, and business mentors.
Utilizing online tools and platforms: project management software, communication apps, and financial management systems.
Seeking professional development opportunities: attending workshops, conferences, and advanced training programs.
Creating a resource directory tailored to the doula's specific needs and goals.

lessons.title: Developing a Personalized Action Plan for Growth
outline: Setting SMART goals: Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, and Time-bound.
Prioritizing action steps based on impact and feasibility.
Creating a timeline with milestones and deadlines.
Identifying potential obstacles and developing contingency plans.
Establishing accountability mechanisms: tracking progress, seeking feedback, and celebrating successes.

lessons.title: Overcoming Fear of Visibility and Self-Promotion
outline: Addressing the root causes of fear of visibility: fear of judgment, rejection, or criticism.
Reframing self-promotion as service: highlighting the value and benefits offered to clients.
Developing a confident and authentic brand voice.
Strategies for building online presence: creating engaging content, utilizing social media effectively, and networking with influencers.
Practicing self-compassion and celebrating small wins along the way.

lessons.title: The Psychology of Motivation in Doula Coaching
outline: Understanding Intrinsic vs. Extrinsic Motivation: How these different types of motivation affect doulas and their businesses.
Applying Self-Determination Theory: Exploring the importance of autonomy, competence, and relatedness in fostering motivation.
Growth Mindset vs. Fixed Mindset: Helping doulas cultivate a growth mindset to overcome challenges and embrace learning.
Motivational Interviewing Techniques: Adapting principles of motivational interviewing to inspire action in doula clients.
Case Study: A doula struggling with burnout. How can understanding motivational factors help her regain passion and drive?

lessons.title: Setting Powerful and Achievable Goals
outline: The Importance of Vision: Guiding doulas to create a compelling vision for their future practice.
SMART Goals Revisited (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound): Practical application in the context of doula work.
Beyond SMART: Incorporating values and meaning into goal setting to enhance motivation.
Breaking Down Large Goals: Strategies for creating smaller, manageable steps to avoid feeling overwhelmed.
Using Visualization Techniques: How to help doulas visualize success and maintain motivation during challenging times.

lessons.title: Overcoming Fear and Self-Doubt
outline: Identifying Limiting Beliefs: Recognizing common negative thought patterns that hold doulas back.
Cognitive Restructuring Techniques: Challenging and reframing negative thoughts to build confidence.
Building Self-Efficacy: Strategies for helping doulas develop a strong belief in their ability to succeed.
The Power of Positive Self-Talk: Encouraging doulas to cultivate a supportive inner voice.
Addressing Imposter Syndrome: Providing tools and techniques to combat feelings of inadequacy.

lessons.title: Building Momentum and Maintaining Motivation
outline: Creating a Supportive Environment: The importance of community and connection for sustained motivation.
Celebrating Small Wins: Recognizing and acknowledging progress to maintain momentum.
Tracking Progress and Measuring Results: Using data to stay motivated and make informed decisions.
Developing Accountability Systems: Implementing strategies to ensure consistent action and follow-through.
The Role of Rituals and Routines: Establishing habits that support motivation and productivity.

lessons.title: Utilizing Strengths to Fuel Action
outline: Identifying Core Strengths: Using assessment tools to uncover doulas' unique talents and abilities.
Leveraging Strengths in Business Development: How to apply strengths to marketing, client acquisition, and service delivery.
Delegating Weaknesses: Recognizing areas where doulas can seek support or outsource tasks.
Building a Strengths-Based Team: The benefits of collaborating with others who complement your strengths.
Case Study: A doula with strong communication skills who can leverage this in workshops and public speaking to attract clients.

lessons.title: The Art of Effective Communication for Inspiration
outline: Active Listening Skills: Deepening your ability to understand and connect with doula clients.
Powerful Questioning Techniques: Using open-ended questions to stimulate reflection and inspire action.
Providing Constructive Feedback: Delivering feedback in a way that motivates and empowers doulas.
Non-Verbal Communication: Understanding the impact of body language, tone of voice, and eye contact.
Using Storytelling to Inspire: Sharing stories of success and resilience to motivate clients.

lessons.title: Inspiring Action Through Effective Goal Setting
outline: Review of SMART Goals: Ensuring doula clients understand and can apply the SMART framework effectively.
Vision Boards and Future Self Exercises: Utilizing visual aids to clarify goals and build excitement.
Action Planning: Creating detailed, step-by-step plans to achieve desired outcomes.
Time Management Strategies: Helping doulas prioritize tasks and manage their time effectively.
Overcoming Procrastination: Identifying the root causes of procrastination and implementing strategies to overcome it.

lessons.title: Ethical Considerations in Inspiring Action
outline: Maintaining Client Autonomy: Ensuring that doulas make their own decisions and retain control of their businesses.
Avoiding Coercion or Manipulation: Recognizing and avoiding techniques that undermine client autonomy.
Setting Realistic Expectations: Providing honest and accurate information about the challenges and rewards of doula work.
Addressing Scope of Practice: Understanding the boundaries of doula coaching and referring clients to other professionals when necessary.
Confidentiality and Privacy: Protecting client information and maintaining confidentiality at all times.

lessons.title: The Power of Systems in Doula Practices
outline: Define what constitutes a 'system' within the context of a doula business and why systematic approaches are crucial for sustainable growth.
Explain the benefits of implementing systems: increased efficiency, consistency in service delivery, improved client satisfaction, and reduced stress for the doula.
Discuss the pitfalls of operating without systems: burnout, inconsistent client experiences, difficulty scaling the business, and potential for errors.
Introduce the concept of process mapping as a tool for visualizing and optimizing existing workflows.
Provide examples of successful systems used by other doulas (e.g., client onboarding, appointment scheduling, follow-up communication).
Explore how effective systems contribute to building a strong brand reputation.

lessons.title: Client Acquisition Systems: From Inquiry to Signed Contract
outline: Develop a standardized inquiry response system: automated email templates, phone scripts, and qualification questions.
Create a streamlined process for scheduling and conducting initial consultations: pre-consultation questionnaires, structured consultation agendas, and follow-up protocols.
Design a consistent and professional contract and payment system: clear terms of service, payment schedules, and secure payment processing options.
Implement a system for collecting testimonials and reviews: automated requests, feedback forms, and strategies for showcasing positive feedback.
Explore the use of CRM (Customer Relationship Management) software to manage client interactions and track progress through the acquisition funnel.
Discuss strategies for analyzing client acquisition data to identify areas for improvement and optimize marketing efforts.

lessons.title: Service Delivery Systems: Ensuring Consistent and Exceptional Care
outline: Establish a standardized system for prenatal visits: structured agendas, educational materials, and documentation templates.
Develop a clear protocol for labor and birth support: communication strategies with the birthing team, comfort measures, and decision-making support.
Create a postpartum visit system: assessment tools for maternal and newborn well-being, support resources, and follow-up plans.
Design a system for documenting client interactions and progress: standardized note-taking templates, secure storage of client information, and compliance with privacy regulations.
Explore options for providing virtual doula support: technology tools, communication protocols, and strategies for building rapport remotely.
Discuss methods for gathering client feedback on service delivery and using it to improve the doula's practice.

lessons.title: Financial Management Systems: Tracking Income, Expenses, and Profitability
outline: Implement a system for tracking income and expenses: accounting software, spreadsheets, and receipt management.
Develop a pricing strategy that reflects the doula's value and covers business expenses: market research, cost analysis, and profit margin considerations.
Create a budget and financial forecast: projecting income, expenses, and profitability over time.
Establish a system for managing taxes: estimated tax payments, deductions, and compliance with tax regulations.
Explore options for saving and investing business profits: retirement accounts, investment vehicles, and financial planning.
Discuss the importance of separating personal and business finances for clarity and accountability.

lessons.title: Time Management & Scheduling Systems: Maximizing Productivity and Avoiding Burnout
outline: Implement time-blocking techniques to allocate specific time slots for different tasks: client appointments, marketing, administrative work, and personal time.
Utilize scheduling tools to manage appointments and availability: online calendars, appointment scheduling software, and automated reminders.
Delegate tasks to assistants or subcontractors to free up time for core doula activities: administrative support, marketing, and social media management.
Establish boundaries between work and personal life to prevent burnout: setting work hours, disconnecting from technology, and prioritizing self-care.
Learn to say 'no' to requests that do not align with the doula's priorities or capacity.
Develop a system for tracking time spent on different tasks to identify areas where efficiency can be improved.

lessons.title: Communication Systems: Building Strong Relationships with Clients and Professionals
outline: Develop a consistent brand voice and messaging: website copy, social media posts, and email communication.
Create templates for common email responses: inquiries, appointment confirmations, follow-up messages, and thank-you notes.
Implement a system for managing client communication: email filtering, phone call logs, and secure messaging platforms.
Establish a protocol for communicating with healthcare providers: building rapport, sharing information, and advocating for clients.
Develop a system for soliciting and responding to client feedback: surveys, reviews, and testimonials.
Explore strategies for using social media to connect with potential clients and build a professional online presence.

lessons.title: Marketing Systems: Attracting Ideal Clients and Building Brand Awareness
outline: Define the target audience for the doula's services: demographics, values, and needs.
Develop a marketing plan that outlines specific strategies for reaching the target audience: online advertising, social media marketing, networking, and referrals.
Create a system for tracking marketing results: website traffic, lead generation, and conversion rates.
Implement a system for nurturing leads: email marketing, content marketing, and personalized communication.
Explore options for collaborating with other birth professionals: cross-promotion, joint workshops, and referral partnerships.
Discuss the importance of building a strong online presence: website optimization, search engine optimization (SEO), and social media engagement.

lessons.title: System Optimization and Automation: Scaling Your Doula Business
outline: Identify opportunities to automate repetitive tasks: email marketing, appointment scheduling, and client onboarding.
Utilize technology tools to streamline workflows: CRM software, project management software, and accounting software.
Regularly review and update systems to ensure they are efficient and effective.
Solicit feedback from clients and colleagues to identify areas for improvement.
Explore options for outsourcing tasks to virtual assistants or other professionals.
Discuss the importance of continuous learning and professional development to stay up-to-date on best practices and emerging technologies.

lessons.title: Establishing Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for Doula Practices
outline: Defining KPIs: Understanding the difference between leading and lagging indicators in the context of a doula business.
Identifying Relevant KPIs: Selecting KPIs aligned with the client's specific goals (e.g., client acquisition, client satisfaction, revenue growth, birth outcomes).
Setting SMART Goals: Applying the SMART (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound) framework to define target values for each KPI.
Data Collection Methods: Exploring various methods for collecting KPI data, including client surveys, financial records, and birth outcome tracking systems.
Ethical Considerations: Discussing the ethical implications of tracking and using client data, emphasizing privacy and informed consent.

lessons.title: Implementing Data Tracking and Analysis Systems
outline: Choosing the Right Tools: Evaluating different software and platforms for data tracking and analysis (e.g., CRM systems, spreadsheets, specialized doula management tools).
Creating Data Collection Templates: Developing standardized templates for collecting consistent and accurate data from clients and other sources.
Data Entry and Management Best Practices: Establishing efficient workflows for data entry, cleaning, and storage to ensure data integrity.
Basic Data Analysis Techniques: Introducing simple statistical methods for analyzing KPI data, such as calculating averages, percentages, and trends.
Visualizing Data: Creating charts and graphs to effectively communicate KPI performance and identify areas for improvement.

lessons.title: Client Feedback Mechanisms and Analysis
outline: Designing Effective Client Surveys: Crafting survey questions that elicit valuable feedback on the client's doula services and overall experience.
Implementing Feedback Collection Processes: Establishing systems for collecting client feedback through surveys, interviews, and online reviews.
Analyzing Qualitative Feedback: Identifying recurring themes and patterns in client comments and testimonials to understand their perspectives.
Addressing Negative Feedback: Developing strategies for responding to and resolving client complaints in a professional and constructive manner.
Using Feedback for Service Improvement: Utilizing client feedback to identify areas for service enhancement and innovation.

lessons.title: Regular Performance Reviews and Self-Assessment
outline: Scheduling Regular Reviews: Establishing a consistent schedule for reviewing KPI performance and client feedback (e.g., monthly, quarterly, annually).
Conducting Self-Assessments: Using self-assessment tools to evaluate the client's skills, knowledge, and overall performance as a doula.
Identifying Strengths and Weaknesses: Analyzing performance data and self-assessments to pinpoint areas of strength and areas needing improvement.
Seeking Peer Feedback: Encouraging clients to seek feedback from other doulas or mentors to gain additional perspectives on their performance.
Celebrating Successes: Recognizing and celebrating achievements to maintain motivation and build confidence.

lessons.title: Adapting Strategies Based on Evaluation Results
outline: Identifying Areas for Adjustment: Using evaluation data to pinpoint specific strategies or processes that require modification.
Brainstorming Alternative Approaches: Exploring different options for addressing identified weaknesses or challenges.
Prioritizing Changes: Determining which changes to implement first based on their potential impact and feasibility.
Developing Action Plans: Creating detailed action plans for implementing the selected changes, including specific steps, timelines, and responsibilities.
Communicating Changes to Clients: Informing clients about any changes to services or processes in a clear and transparent manner.

lessons.title: Continuous Professional Development and Skill Enhancement
outline: Identifying Skill Gaps: Using performance reviews and self-assessments to identify areas where the client needs to enhance their skills or knowledge.
Exploring Professional Development Opportunities: Researching relevant workshops, conferences, online courses, and certifications.
Creating a Professional Development Plan: Developing a personalized plan for continuous learning and skill enhancement.
Implementing New Skills and Knowledge: Applying newly acquired skills and knowledge to improve the client's doula services.
Staying Updated on Industry Trends: Monitoring the latest research, best practices, and innovations in the field of doula care.

lessons.title: Refining Business Systems for Scalability and Sustainability
outline: Evaluating Existing Systems: Reviewing current business systems for client acquisition, service delivery, and business management.
Identifying Bottlenecks and Inefficiencies: Pinpointing areas where the client's systems are hindering growth or creating unnecessary workload.
Streamlining Processes: Optimizing workflows to improve efficiency and reduce errors.
Automating Tasks: Exploring opportunities to automate repetitive tasks using software or other tools.
Delegating Responsibilities: Identifying tasks that can be delegated to assistants or other team members to free up the client's time.

lessons.title: Long-Term Growth Planning and Goal Setting
outline: Revisiting Long-Term Goals: Reviewing the client's original goals and adjusting them as needed based on their progress and changing circumstances.
Setting New Goals: Establishing ambitious yet achievable goals for the future of the client's doula practice.
Developing a Long-Term Growth Plan: Creating a comprehensive plan for achieving the client's long-term goals, including specific strategies, timelines, and resources.
Monitoring Progress and Making Adjustments: Continuously tracking progress towards the client's goals and making adjustments to the plan as needed.
Celebrating Milestones: Recognizing and celebrating significant milestones along the way to maintain motivation and momentum.

lessons.title: Introduction to the G.U.I.D.E. Framework™ for Doula Coaching
outline: Overview of the G.U.I.D.E. Framework™ and its application to doula coaching.
Detailed explanation of each letter in the G.U.I.D.E. Framework™: Gather Information, Uncover Potential, Inspire Action, Develop Systems, Evaluate & Evolve.
How the G.U.I.D.E. Framework™ provides a structured approach to coaching doulas, ensuring comprehensive support and sustainable growth.
Ethical considerations and best practices when applying the G.U.I.D.E. Framework™.
Setting expectations with clients about the coaching process and the role of the G.U.I.D.E. Framework™.

lessons.title: Gather Information: Assessing the Doula's Current Landscape
outline: Techniques for conducting thorough initial assessments of a doula's practice, including questionnaires, interviews, and observation.
Identifying key performance indicators (KPIs) relevant to a doula's success (e.g., client acquisition rate, client satisfaction, income).
Analyzing the doula's current marketing efforts, client communication strategies, and service offerings.
Evaluating the doula's existing support system and professional network.
Using assessment data to create a baseline understanding of the doula's strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats (SWOT analysis).

lessons.title: Uncover Potential: Identifying Strengths and Opportunities
outline: Methods for identifying a doula's unique skills, talents, and experiences that can be leveraged for growth.
Exploring potential niche markets and specialized services the doula could offer (e.g., bereavement doula, sibling doula, VBAC support).
Assessing the doula's current mindset and identifying limiting beliefs that may be hindering their progress.
Facilitating self-discovery and helping the doula articulate their vision for their practice.
Developing a personalized action plan based on the doula's strengths and identified opportunities.

lessons.title: Inspire Action: Motivating and Empowering Doulas
outline: Strategies for building rapport and trust with doula clients to foster a strong coaching relationship.
Using motivational interviewing techniques to encourage self-directed change and commitment.
Setting realistic and achievable goals that align with the doula's vision and values.
Providing ongoing support and encouragement to help the doula overcome challenges and stay on track.
Celebrating successes and reinforcing positive behaviors to build confidence and momentum.

lessons.title: Develop Systems: Creating Sustainable Business Practices
outline: Designing effective client intake and onboarding processes to ensure a positive client experience.
Implementing efficient scheduling and communication systems to streamline workflow.
Developing marketing strategies to attract ideal clients and build a strong brand presence.
Creating financial management systems to track income, expenses, and profitability.
Establishing clear service agreements and policies to protect the doula's business and clients.

lessons.title: Evaluate & Evolve: Monitoring Progress and Adapting Strategies
outline: Methods for tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) and measuring the effectiveness of implemented strategies.
Conducting regular check-ins with the doula to assess progress, identify challenges, and make adjustments to the action plan.
Using feedback from clients and peers to refine service offerings and improve client satisfaction.
Staying up-to-date on industry trends and best practices to ensure the doula's practice remains competitive.
Promoting continuous learning and professional development to support the doula's long-term growth.

lessons.title: Overcoming Common Challenges in Doula Coaching
outline: Addressing client resistance to change and building buy-in for the coaching process.
Managing unrealistic expectations and setting appropriate boundaries with clients.
Dealing with burnout and maintaining motivation as a doula coach.
Navigating ethical dilemmas and maintaining confidentiality.
Adapting the G.U.I.D.E. Framework™ to meet the unique needs of diverse doula clients.

lessons.title: Advanced Coaching Techniques for Doula Professionals
outline: Utilizing advanced communication skills such as active listening, powerful questioning, and reframing.
Employing visualization and other mindset techniques to help doulas overcome limiting beliefs and achieve their goals.
Facilitating group coaching sessions to foster peer support and collaboration.
Integrating technology and online tools to enhance the coaching experience.
Developing a long-term coaching strategy to support the doula's ongoing growth and success.

lessons.title: Introduction to the Doula Coaching Landscape
outline: Overview of the growing demand for doula coaching and its potential impact.
Defining the unique role of a Birth Doula Coach™ and differentiating it from traditional doula work and general life coaching.
Exploring the ethical considerations and scope of practice for Birth Doula Coaches™.
Examining the current market trends and opportunities within the doula coaching industry.
Setting realistic expectations for the coaching journey and understanding the investment required for success.

lessons.title: Mastering the 'G' of GUIDE: Gathering Information Effectively
outline: Developing a structured intake process to collect comprehensive client information (experience, skills, client base, challenges, goals).
Crafting powerful intake questionnaires and interview questions to uncover key insights about the client's doula practice.
Utilizing active listening techniques and empathetic communication to build rapport and trust with potential clients.
Identifying specific data points to track and analyze to measure client progress and coaching effectiveness.
Using case studies to illustrate effective information gathering techniques and potential pitfalls to avoid.

lessons.title: Unveiling the 'U' of GUIDE: Uncovering Client Potential
outline: Utilizing strengths-based assessments and positive psychology principles to identify client strengths and resources.
Conducting SWOT (Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, Threats) analysis to assess the client's current situation and future possibilities.
Helping clients identify limiting beliefs and negative thought patterns that hinder their professional growth.
Facilitating self-discovery through reflective exercises and journaling prompts to unlock hidden potential.
Developing strategies for overcoming imposter syndrome and building self-confidence in doula practice.

lessons.title: Igniting the 'I' of GUIDE: Inspiring Action and Motivation
outline: Employing motivational interviewing techniques to elicit intrinsic motivation and commitment to change.
Setting SMART (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound) goals that align with the client's values and aspirations.
Creating a supportive and encouraging coaching environment that fosters accountability and perseverance.
Developing strategies for overcoming procrastination and building momentum towards achieving desired outcomes.
Using visualization techniques and positive affirmations to enhance self-efficacy and confidence in doula skills.

lessons.title: Designing the 'D' of GUIDE: Developing Sustainable Systems
outline: Creating client acquisition strategies, including marketing, networking, and referral programs.
Developing efficient service delivery systems, including client communication protocols, appointment scheduling, and documentation processes.
Implementing effective business management systems, including financial tracking, invoicing, and contract management.
Leveraging technology and automation tools to streamline operations and improve efficiency.
Building a strong brand identity and online presence to attract and retain clients.

lessons.title: Executing the 'E' of GUIDE: Evaluating & Evolving the Coaching Process
outline: Establishing key performance indicators (KPIs) to track client progress and coaching effectiveness.
Conducting regular progress reviews and feedback sessions to assess the impact of implemented strategies.
Adapting the coaching approach based on client feedback and evolving needs.
Utilizing data analysis to identify areas for improvement and optimize coaching interventions.
Developing a continuous learning plan to stay updated on the latest trends and best practices in doula coaching.

lessons.title: Building Your Doula Coaching Business: Practical Steps
outline: Defining your niche and target market within the doula coaching industry.
Developing a compelling coaching package and pricing structure.
Creating a professional website and online presence.
Networking with other doulas and birth professionals.
Legal and business considerations: contracts, insurance, and business structures.

lessons.title: Ethical Considerations and Best Practices in Doula Coaching
outline: Maintaining confidentiality and privacy of client information.
Avoiding conflicts of interest and maintaining professional boundaries.
Providing evidence-based information and avoiding unsupported claims.
Respecting client autonomy and informed decision-making.
Adhering to ethical guidelines and professional standards for doula coaches.

lessons.title: Introduction to the G.U.I.D.E. Framework™ for Doula Coaching
